messages.content: are there any rpg systems for intercourse? like dnd, but for sexual encounters? preferably open source or permissive licensing.

While a definitive list of open-source RPG systems created explicitly for sexual encounters is difficult to provide, several avenues exist for exploring this niche, keeping in mind the importance of community standards, legal regulations, and player comfort.

**Open Source RPGs and Customization:**

Many general open-source RPG systems can be adapted for adult themes due to their customizable nature [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0), [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). Systems like FATE, OpenD6, and Powered by the Apocalypse are popular options that can be modified to include mechanics for sexual encounters [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). Open source RPGs often have active communities where users share ideas and custom modules [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).

**Specific Examples and Resources:**

*   **LifePlay** is a free, open-source life simulation RPG with NSFW content, licensed under AGPL-3.0 [github](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **RyonaRPG** is an open-source erotic RPG using the RPG Maker 2000 engine [anime-sharing](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1).
*   **itch.io** hosts a variety of adult-themed and solo RPGs, some of which are open source or use public domain licenses [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5), [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2), [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3), [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4). These include visual novels and games with themes like erotic horror [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3), [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4).
*   **Ren'Py** is an open-source visual novel engine that can be used to create interactive stories with adult themes [renpy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).

**Licensing and Legal Considerations:**

Many open-source RPGs use the Open Game License (OGL) or Creative Commons licenses, allowing for modification of the source material [opensource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7), [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). However, be aware of "community standards" when publishing content, especially sexually explicit content [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). Online platforms are obligated to remove illegal content and protect children, sometimes requiring age verification for certain adult content [nexusmods](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-11).

**Mechanics for Sexual Encounters:**

Some RPGs incorporate mechanics that focus on or include sexual encounters [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).

*   **Sex Moves:** Games like *Apocalypse World* and *Monsterhearts* feature "sex moves," which are mechanics that trigger when characters have sex [stackexchange](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4), [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5), [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Relationship Stats:** Some games use relationship stats to track the strength of connections between characters [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7).
*   **Intimacy Moves:** *Urban Shadows* features an Intimacy move that determines what happens when characters share a moment of intimacy [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5).

**Tools for Player Comfort and Consent:**

*   **Lines and Veils:** Many groups use "Lines" and "Veils" to negotiate explicit content [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **The X Card:** The X card can be held up to stop a potentially triggering situation [dicebreaker](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2), [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).
*   **Consent-based mechanics and intimacy tools:** These ensure players can enjoy and participate fully [calstate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3).

When creating or sharing adult-themed content, it's crucial to be mindful of community standards, legal regulations, and the comfort levels of all players involved [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

search_query: open source rpg system for sexual encounters
permissive licensed rpg system for sexual encounters

Are there any specific examples of open-source RPG systems or modules that have been successfully adapted or created for explicitly sexual encounters, while adhering to community standards and legal regulations?
What are some common mechanics or rulesets used in RPGs that focus on or incorporate sexual encounters, and how do they differ from those used in traditional combat or skill-based systems?
web_research_result:
While I can't provide a list of open-source RPG systems specifically designed for sexual encounters, I can offer some information based on my search:

**Open Source RPG Systems:**

*   **General Open Source RPGs:** Many open-source RPG systems are available that can be adapted for various themes, including adult themes. Some popular options include FATE, OpenD6, and Powered by the Apocalypse [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).
*   **Customization:** Open source RPGs are designed to be customizable, allowing players and creators to modify and expand the mechanics [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). This makes it possible to tailor the rules to include more explicit content or mechanics for sexual encounters.
*   **Community Collaboration:** Many open-source RPGs have active communities where users share ideas, custom modules, and collaborate on new adventures [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). These communities can be a valuable resource for finding or creating content related to adult themes.

**Adult-Themed RPGs and Resources:**

*   **Erotic RPGs:** Some RPGs focus on intimate aspects of a fantasy world, covering topics like conception, marriage, love, and relationships [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).
*   **AI-Powered Erotic Text RPGs:** AI-powered text RPGs with a focus on character customization and body transformation are available [weightgaming](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4). These games often allow players to input custom content and scenarios.
*   **Adult and Solo RPGs:** Platforms like itch.io host a variety of adult-themed and solo RPGs, some of which are open source or use public domain licenses [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5). These games often explore themes of sexuality, erotic horror, and transformation.
*   **Ren'Py:** Ren'Py is a visual novel engine that is open source and free for commercial use [renpy](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6). It can be used to create interactive stories with adult themes and is supported on various platforms.

**Important Considerations:**

*   **Open Game License (OGL) and Creative Commons:** Many open-source RPGs use the OGL or Creative Commons licenses, which allow for copying and modification of the source material [opensource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   **Community Standards:** When creating or sharing adult-themed content, it's important to be mindful of community standards and legal regulations regarding explicit content.
*   **Personalization:** Many RPG systems rely on players to add their own creative input and "fluff text" to create unique and personalized experiences [blogspot](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8).

It's important to note that while these resources may be helpful in finding or creating an open-source RPG system for sexual encounters, the user is responsible for ensuring that the content is appropriate and complies with all applicable laws and community guidelines.
The search for a "permissive licensed RPG system for sexual encounters" reveals a complex landscape of tabletop role-playing game (TTRPG) licenses, systems, and community attitudes towards sexual content. Here's a breakdown of the findings:

**1. Open Game Licenses (OGL) and Permissive Systems**

*   **d20 System and OGL:** The d20 System, originally developed for Dungeons & Dragons 3rd edition, was released under the Open Game License (OGL) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). This allows commercial and non-commercial publishers to create modifications or supplements to the system without paying for intellectual property rights [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). However, Wizards of the Coast (WotC) can exert discretionary power over what counts as legitimate d20 material [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Cypher System Open License (CSOL):** The Cypher System Open License (CSOL) allows publishers, gamers, and members of the public to freely create and publish tabletop roleplaying games compatible with, and using the rules from, the Cypher System [montecookgames](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1).
*   **Open RPG Creative License (ORC):** The ORC License grants the right to use Licensed Material subject to the terms and conditions set forth and referenced [paizo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2).
*   **Year Zero Engine Free Tabletop Licence (FTL):** The Year Zero Engine Free Tabletop Licence (FTL) gives all creators an irrevocable, worldwide, and royalty-free right to use the Year Zero Engine Standard Reference Document (YZE SRD) and freely publish their own roleplaying games based on it [freeleaguepublishing](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).
*   **Savage Worlds:** There are currently four ways to use the Savage Worlds game system for your own materials: the unapproved Fan license, the Savage Worlds Adventurer's Guild, the Media Network Content license, and the official license for Aces [peginc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4).

**2. Sexual Content in RPGs**

*   **Community Standards:** Wizards of the Coast changed the d20 license to require publications to meet "community standards of decency" [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). This was prompted by the announcement of the sexually explicit *Book of Erotic Fantasy* [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Explicit Content:** Mainstream TTRPGs, such as Dungeons & Dragons (D&D), have generally avoided explicit sexual content in their texts [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Emergence of Adult Themes:** Small publishing companies and independent authors have created games that embrace sexually violent themes [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Tools for Player Comfort:** Tools like "the X card" allow players to instantly shut down any uncomfortable role-playing situations [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Mature Handling:** The *Book of Erotic Fantasy* handles the subject of sex in a mature and well-thought-out manner [paizo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6).

**3. Specific RPGs with Mature Themes**

*   **Monsterhearts 2:** Each playbook has a unique sex move, and one of the character moves is "turn someone on" [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7). It's all about hormonal and horny angsty teenage monsters [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   **Unknown Armies 3e:** You can play as a pornomancer, or as an avatar of the living embodiment of lust [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   **World of Darkness (e.g., Vampire the Masquerade):** The books are firmly 18+ and being a vampire can get pretty twisted [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   **Honey and Hot Wax:** A game anthology that is all about sex [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).

**4. Licensing Considerations**

*   **System vs. Brand:** It's important to note the distinction between licensing a system and a brand [giantitp](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9). You can use the d20 system, but you can't claim your module is for D&D 3.5 without permission [giantitp](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9).
*   **"Community Standards":** Be aware of "community standards" when publishing content, especially sexually explicit content [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Professional Advice:** If you are serious about making money off an OGL game you've made, it's probably worth hiring a professional to help you guard yourself in case they decide to make a claim [giantitp](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9).

**5. Permissive Play**

*   **Definition:** Permissive play involves players making statements rather than asking questions, with anything not explicitly stated being open for other players to fill in [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10).
*   **Focus on Story:** Permissive rules require you to treat the story, the table conversation, as primary and the game world as derived [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10).

**6. Cautions and Considerations**

*   **Player Comfort:** Sexual content rarely works in RPGs because it is very likely to make people uncomfortable [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).
*   **"Fading to Black":** Some groups prefer to "fade to black" when romance becomes sexually intimate [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8).
*   **Content Warnings:** Content warnings and explanations for the inclusion of sensitive content are important [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
While a direct, definitive list of open-source RPG systems or modules explicitly created for sexual encounters while adhering to community standards and legal regulations is difficult to compile, the search results provide valuable insights into the topic:

**1. Examples of Open-Source RPGs with NSFW Content:**

*   **LifePlay:** A free, open-source, and moddable life simulation RPG with NSFW content [github](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0). It is licensed under AGPL-3.0 [github](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **RyonaRPG:** An open-source erotic RPG using the RPG Maker 2000 engine [anime-sharing](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). The term "ryona" refers to "seeking the bizarre" and masturbation [anime-sharing](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1).
*   **itch.io:** A platform that hosts several NSFW games, some of which are tagged as open-source and created with RPG Maker [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2) [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3) [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4). These include visual novels, simulations, and games with themes like erotic horror or male objectification [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3) [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4).

**2. Community Standards and Guidelines:**

*   **General Prohibition:** Many RPG communities and platforms prohibit explicitly sexual content, intense violence, or content that promotes discrimination [rpgmatch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-5) [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-6). Some set the threshold at a "hard R or NC-17 movie" level [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-6).
*   **Nuance and Maturity:** Some GUMSHOE games have an 18+ rating for violence and sexual content, allowing for darker themes with appropriate content warnings [drivethrurpg](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-7).
*   **Consent and Safety:** Discussions about consent, boundaries, and safety tools (like lines and veils) are crucial in RPGs, especially when dealing with mature or controversial themes [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-9). "Consent in Gaming" is a free PDF resource that offers strategies for ensuring a safe and enjoyable experience for all players [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8).
*   **Community-Specific Rules:** Individual communities often have specific rules regarding NSFW content, with some requiring it to be kept in designated sections or faded to black [rpgfix](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-10).
*   **Legality:** Online platforms are obligated to remove illegal content and protect children, sometimes requiring age verification for certain adult content [nexusmods](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-11).

**3. Legal Considerations:**

*   **Obscenity:** Community standards play a role in determining what is legally obscene, though definitions vary [ebsco](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-12).
*   **UK Law:** UK-based companies are required to remove illegal content and add restrictions to children's access to adult content due to the Online Safety Act and Digital Services Act [nexusmods](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-11).
*   **Terms of Service:** Online platforms often have Terms of Service that users must agree to, which absolve the platform of liability for misuse of resources [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-13).

**4. Challenges and Approaches:**

*   **Balancing Creativity and Restrictions:** Some users find content policies too restrictive, even when creating non-sexual content [openai](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-14).
*   **Open-Source Models:** Using open-source models may offer more flexibility, but guardrails are still needed to prevent inappropriate content generation [openai](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-14).
*   **Tagging and Categorization:** Platforms use tagging systems to categorize and filter adult content, allowing users to control their experience [nexusmods](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-11).

**5. Resources and Communities:**

*   **itch.io:** A digital marketplace with a variety of NSFW games, including some that are open-source [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3) [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2) [itch](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4).
*   **SillyTavern:** A web UI for roleplaying with local language models, offering customization options and character expressions [youtube](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-15).
*   **r/NSFW_GMing:** A Reddit community dedicated to NSFW RPG systems [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-16).

It's important to note that the legality and acceptability of sexually explicit content in RPGs depend heavily on local laws, community standards, and individual preferences.
While mainstream tabletop role-playing games (TTRPGs) have generally avoided explicit sexual content, some games incorporate mechanics that focus on or include sexual encounters [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). These games often differ significantly from traditional combat or skill-based systems, with a greater emphasis on roleplaying, storytelling, and exploring character relationships [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1) [dicebreaker](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).

**Common Mechanics and Rulesets:**

*   **Lines and Veils:** Many groups use "Lines" and "Veils" to negotiate explicit content, rather than relaying blow-by-blow accounts of sexual activity [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1). Lines are hard boundaries that are not to be crossed, where a player may veto a subject completely [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1). A Veil is more of a fade to black; the player acknowledges the activity, but nothing is described [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Consent-based mechanics and intimacy tools:** These ensure players can enjoy and participate fully [calstate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3).
*   **Sex Moves:** Some games, like *Apocalypse World* and *Monsterhearts*, feature "sex moves," which are mechanics that trigger when characters have sex [stackexchange](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4) [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5). These moves reflect the effects of personal intimacy upon the characters [stackexchange](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4). *Monsterhearts* bases its rules on *Apocalypse World*, but sets the action in a monster-filled high school [vice](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6). Each character type in *Apocalypse World* comes with a custom sex move that allows you to exploit other players or NPC vulnerabilities [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Relationship Stats:** Some games use relationship stats to track the strength of connections between characters. For example, *Apocalypse World* uses a stat called "Hx" to represent the relationship between characters [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7). *Golden Sky Stories* tracks the strength of relationships to fuel stats and special powers [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7).
*   **Intimacy Moves:** *Urban Shadows*, another game based on *Apocalypse World*, features an Intimacy move that determines what happens when characters share a moment of intimacy, whether physical or not [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5).
*   **Dice Rolls and Skill Checks:** Some systems use dice rolls or contested checks to resolve romantic or sexual encounters [worldanvil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8). For example, a player might roll a Performance check to seduce an NPC [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-9).
*   **Narrative Control and GM Discretion:** In many games, sexual encounters are handled narratively, with the Game Master (GM) describing the scene and the players roleplaying their characters' reactions [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1) [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-9). The level of detail and explicitness is often left to the discretion of the GM and the comfort levels of the players [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-9) [worldanvil](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8).
*   **The X Card:** The X card can be held up to stop a potentially triggering situation [dicebreaker](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [sfrareview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).

**Differences from Traditional Systems:**

*   **Focus on Relationships:** Unlike combat-focused systems, these mechanics prioritize the development and exploration of relationships between characters [dicebreaker](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Emphasis on Consent and Safety:** Games that deal with sexual themes often incorporate safety tools and techniques to ensure all players are comfortable and respected [dicebreaker](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [calstate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3).
*   **Narrative over Mechanics:** While some games have specific rules for sexual encounters, many rely on narrative descriptions and roleplaying to drive the story forward [womenwriteaboutcomics](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1) [quora](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-9).
*   **Emotional Impact:** These systems often focus on the emotional and psychological consequences of intimacy, rather than simply resolving a physical act [stackexchange](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).
*   **Social Maneuvering:** Some games, like *Monsterhearts*, place a greater emphasis on social maneuvering and manipulation in the context of relationships and sexuality [reddit](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5).

Some games, such as *F.A.T.A.L.*, have been criticized for their handling of sexual violence and their normalization of non-consensual acts [vice](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-10). However, more recent games strive to create a safe and inclusive environment for exploring these themes [vice](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6).
